meanings.definition: To strike or kick with the hoof.
meanings.sent1: The horse was hoofing the ground in frustration.
meanings.sent2: She hoofed the ball across the field during the game.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was caught hoofing the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The waves hoofed against the rocks, creating a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The boxer was hoofing at his opponent with determination.

meanings.sent1: The kids were hoofing around the living room to their favorite song.
meanings.sent2: At the party, everyone was hoofing to the lively music.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked like it was hoofing on the ice.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were hoofing in the wind, creating a beautiful dance.
meanings.sent5: The crowd started hoofing as soon as the band began to play.

meanings.definition: Large, hard, horny part of the foot of an ungulate animal.
meanings.sent1: The farmer cleaned the horse's hoofing carefully.
meanings.sent2: The hoofing of the cow left imprints in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The hoofing of the goat made a funny clicking sound on the pavement.
meanings.sent4: The hoofing of the deer was well-adapted for running in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The hoofing of the rhinoceros was impressive in size and strength.
